009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a 2D linear filter specified by an arbitrary 2D convolution kernel. It is based on
017 * {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalar}, which take care of all data copying and filter mechanics.
018 * Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars. If the processed image has more than one
019 * component (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically and independently applied to all (scalar-valued)
020 * components. To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)} method, for example.
021 */
022public class LinearFilter extends GenericFilterScalar {
023
024        private final float[][] H;                      // the kernel matrix, note H[y][x]!
025        private final int xc, yc;                       // 'hot spot' coordinates
026        
027        /**
028         * Constructor, only the 2D filter kernel needs to be specified.
029         * 
030         * @param kernel the 2D filter kernel
031         */
032        public LinearFilter(Kernel2D kernel) {
033                this.H = kernel.getH();
034                this.xc = kernel.getXc();
035                this.yc = kernel.getYc();
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
040                double sum = 0;
041                for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
042                        int vj = v + j - yc;
043                        for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
044                                int ui = u + i - xc;
045                                sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
046                        }
047                }
048                return (float)sum;
049//              return convolve(source, H, u, v, xc, yc);
050        }
051        
052//      public static float convolve(PixelSlice plane, float[][] H, int u, int v, int xc, int yc) {
053//              double sum = 0;
054//              for (int j = 0; j < H.length; j++) {
055//                      int vj = v + j - yc;
056//                      for (int i = 0; i < H[j].length; i++) {
057//                              int ui = u + i - xc;
058//                              sum = sum + plane.getVal(ui, vj) * H[j][i];
059//                      }
060//              }
061//              return (float)sum;
062//      }
063
064}
